projects: [{"title":"Optimizing daily dray operations","start_date":"Jul 2020","end_date":"Present","description":"‚Ä¢ Intermodal freight operations involve heavy dray operations on a daily basis, the project is based on the idea of maximizing the driver productivity and minimizing the time and distance associated with moving loaded containers.‚Ä¢ The solution requires fast solve times to cope up with the constantly changing near-real-time data, adjustments to account for traffic congestion and other operational delays and integration with a transportation management system to provide real-time data for driver-assignment recommendation."},{"title":"Demand-Supply Linear Problem","start_date":"Nov 2019","end_date":"Feb 2020","description":"‚Ä¢ The objectives were to optimize the number of containers loaded on to a train and the profit generated from the loaded containers, subjected to payload constraints, pattern constraints and cost constraints.‚Ä¢ I formulated the mathematical LP for the problem and coded it in CBC using python API. I computed the optimal solution for the problem.‚Ä¢ There were cases when the problem didn‚Äôt have an optimal solution during which the most feasible solution was evaluated. "}]
